Award.AwardTitle: Collaborative Research: New Statistical Learning for Complex Heterogeneous Data
Award.AbstractNarration: This project focuses on several important and challenging issues concerning complex heterogeneous data that arise from medical imaging and social networks. The major goals are to develop powerful and innovative statistical machine learning methods and tools that are able to flexibly model signal heterogeneity across images, integrate imaging data with multimodal and spatially distributed data, and tackle heterogeneity of network data. The integrated program of research and education will have significant impacts in many different fields such as biomedical studies, genomic research, environmental studies, public health research, and social and political sciences, among others. The project will also stimulate interdisciplinary research and collaboration with scientists from disparate fields.<br/><br/>This project will lead to substantial advancement in heterogeneity learning and modeling through exploiting individual variation from the general population, and integration of multiple sources of imaging information to enhance prediction accuracy for disease diagnoses and treatment outcomes. In addition, this project develops innovative unsupervised learning methods through utilizing node covariate information for analyzing heterogeneous network data. Each component of the research plan contains a broad range of topics, from methodological and computational development to applications in real world problems. Specifically, the PIs study subject-variant scalar-on-image regression models to incorporate the heterogeneity variation for brain imaging data, multi-dimensional tensor learning methods for breast cancer imaging data, flexible Gaussian graphical models for network data, and a novel clustering framework for heterogeneous data that are linked by networks. Furthermore, the development of advanced optimization techniques, algorithms and computational technologies will be applicable to many practical problems arising from large-scale heterogeneous data.<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This proposal focuses on several important and challenging issues concerning complex heterogeneous data that arise from medical imaging and social networks. The major goals are to develop powerful and innovative statistical machine learning methods and tools that are able to flexibly model signal heterogeneity across images, integrate imaging data with multimodal and spatially distributed data, and tackle heterogeneity of network data. The integrated program of research and education have significant impacts in many different fields such as biomedical studies, genomic research, environmental studies, public health research, and social and political sciences, among others. This also stimulates interdisciplinary research and collaboration with scientists from disparate fields.

 

Intellectual Merit:

The PI has developed an innovative multi-dimensional tensor learning method to predict clinical outcomes through utilizing subject-wise imaging information for breast cancer optical imaging,  developing efficient computational algorithms and platforms integrated with the proposed research which are applicable for large-scale complex data. The proposed project leads to substantial improvement of heterogeneous learning and modeling through integrating multiple sources of imaging information to enhance prediction precision for disease diagnoses and treatment outcomes. The research plan contains a broad range of topics, from methodological and computational development to applications in real world problems. In particular, we propose multi-dimensional tensor learning methods for breast cancer optical imaging data to leverage additional layer of individual structures. In addition, the experience we gain from the proposed research, particularly the development of statistical methodology and theory, are valuable for handling other types of large-scale complex data as well. Furthermore, the development of the advanced optimization techniques, algorithms and computational technology are also applicable to many practical problems arising from large-scale heterogeneous data.

Broader Impact:

The integrated program of research and education has significant impacts in many different fields such as biomedical studies, genomic research, environmental studies, public health research, and social and political science, among others. This stimulates interdisciplinary research and collaboration with scientists from disparate fields. The proposed project requires extensive algorithm and software development for target applications. In particular, the three PIs develop R, Matlab, Python, and C++ software which facilitate the formulation and implementation of the proposed methods on individualized multilayer tensor learning in imaging analysis. The developed software has been disseminated to facilitate statistical analyses and applications for large-scale heterogeneous data. Another important part of this project is the integration of education with research. The three PIs co-organized conferences/workshops on statistical learning on data integration for heterogeneous data.  The PI integrates the proposed research areas substantially into educational activities through development a new topic course which also significantly advances undergraduate and graduate students' learning and training. In particular, we have developed a short course on deep learning, and gave a short course at SDSS conference in June, 2021.

 


Last Modified: 11/01/2021
Modified by: Annie Qu
